import pprint
import json
from pyspark.sql.types import *
import random
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
from faker import Faker
from pyspark.sql.functions import lit, monotonically_increasing_id, col

std_schema = StructType.fromJson(json.loads(mssparkutils.notebook.run(path="service-bus/py_create_spark_schema", 
                            arguments={"entity_name": entity_name, "db_name": std_db_name})))

hrm_schema = StructType.fromJson(json.loads(mssparkutils.notebook.run(path="service-bus/py_create_spark_schema", 
                            arguments={"entity_name": entity_name, "db_name": hrm_db_name})))

existing_message_ids = set(random_df.select("message_id").rdd.flatMap(lambda x: x).collect())

top_100_df = random_df.limit(100)

new_message_ids = generate_unique_uuids(existing_message_ids, 100)

deleted_df = (
    top_100_df.rdd
    .zipWithIndex()  # Add an index to align with the new_message_ids
    .map(lambda row: {**row[0].asDict(), "message_id": new_message_ids[row[1]], "message_type": "delete"})  # Update message_id and message_type
    .toDF(schema=top_100_df.schema)  # Convert back to a DataFrame
